snippet: Corrections appearing in print on December 15, 2011.
“Lysistrata Jones” is a throwback to the perishable good-time musicals in which peppy kids delivered of-the-moment jokes and lively dances.
abstract: Ben Brantley reviews Transport Group Theater production of Douglas Carter Beane play Lysistrata Jones at Walter Kerr Theater; Dan Knechtges directs and Patti Murin stars.

headline.main: Yes, Even Sexting Is Off Limits
headline.print_headline: Yes, Even Sexting Is Off Limits

snippet: Think outside the iPhone box when choosing gifts for the tech-minded. Consider a water clock or a portable Wi-Fi hot spot.
abstract: David Pogue State of The Art column features 12 high-tech gift suggestions.

headline.main: Beyond the Passé in Tech Gifts
headline.print_headline: Beyond The Passé In Tech Gifts

snippet: On Wednesday, Nokia announced the first step in its comeback in the United States with its first smartphone based on Microsoft’s Windows Phone operating system. Anyone hoping for Nokia to market its return with guns cocked and aimed at Apple...
abstract: On Wednesday, Nokia announced the first step in its comeback in the United States with its first smartphone based on Microsoft’s Windows Phone operating system. Anyone hoping for Nokia to market its return with guns cocked and aimed at Apple and Google is likely to be disappointed, though.

headline.main: Nokia Courts Smartphone Newbies in U.S. Return

snippet: As consumers migrate to mobile apps, app-related search engines and stores, especially for Android, have vastly improved this year.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column observes that, as consumers migrate to mobile apps, app-related search engines and stores, especially for Android, have vastly improved during 2011.

headline.main: Searching for Apps Is Finally Getting Easier
headline.print_headline: Searching for Apps Is Finally Getting Easier

snippet: Start-ups can’t devote resources to building apps for Windows Phone 7 until more customers adopt the platform. But customers will not flock to Windows Phone 7 until their favorite apps exist. Some major applications are intrigued by its uniq...
abstract: Start-ups can’t devote resources to building apps for Windows Phone 7 until more customers adopt the platform. But customers will not flock to Windows Phone 7 until their favorite apps exist. Some major applications are intrigued by its unique design, although they recognize the design may raise development costs.

headline.main: Windows Phone 7 Caught in Mobile App Catch-22

snippet: On Tuesday, the Federal Aviation Administration said that pilots on American Airlines flights would be officially allowed to use iPads instead of paper flight manuals in the cockpit, just a few feet from the most critical aviation equipment on a p...
abstract: On Tuesday, the Federal Aviation Administration said that pilots on American Airlines flights would be officially allowed to use iPads instead of paper flight manuals in the cockpit, just a few feet from the most critical aviation equipment on a plane, even during takeoff and landing. You, back in Seat 32B: turn off that Kindle.

headline.main: F.A.A. Approves iPads in Cockpits, but Not for Passengers
